data.title: Chinese researchers tout ‘invisibility’ breakthrough
data.description: BEIJING - Chinese researchers say they have developed a material that quickly changes colour at a molecular level based on the surrounding light, creating a new form of camouflage that could help people blend into their environments — much like a chameleon.

data.title: TAT projects 40 million foreign tourists in 2025, revenue to rise 7.5%
data.description: Foreign arrivals in Thailand are expected to reach 40 million in 2025 following the government’s measures to stimulate the economy and tourism, according to the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT).

data.title: Criminal probe sought against Malaysian ex-PM Mahathir
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - A Malaysian royal commission studying cases involving three disputed islets in the Singapore Strait has proposed a criminal investigation against former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad, the state news agency Bernama reported on Thursday.

data.title: Buddha’s tooth relic arrives in Bangkok
data.description: China temporarily transfers the relic to Thailand as the two countries celebrate half a century of diplomatic relations

data.title: Beyoncé crowned the pop star of the 21st century by Billboard
data.description: Billboard: Beyonce takes her throne, the best artist of the 21st century, winning Taylor Swift and Rihanna.

data.title: Drunk Benz driver kills motorcyclist
data.description: A drunk executive of a well-known cosmetic clinic was arrested in Bangkok after his Mercedes-Benz struck a parcel delivery rider, knocking her off a flyover onto Rama IV Road below, where she died.

data.title: PM leads ceremony to mark beloved late king’s birthday
data.description: Representatives of government, judiciary, Parliament and security forces gather at Sanam Luang to mark Father’s Day

data.title: Nation Group celebrates King Rama IX’s musical genius with ‘HM Blues’
data.description: Nation Group and its partners hosted a concert titled “HM Blues” to mark His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej the Great’s birthday, National Day and Father’s Day on Wednesday.

data.title: Beauty queen meets buffalo beauties on visit to Bangkok
data.description: In Thailand for her fourth visit, Miss Universe Victoria Kjær Theilvig was reportedly delighted to meet and greet buffaloes Koh Muang Phet and Labubu at Phra Arthit Mansion in Bangkok’s Phra Nakhon district on Wednesday.

data.title: Ubon Art Fest 2024 lays out a feast of art and culture
data.description: From Dec-15, visitors can enjoy three days of art, competitions, music, shopping and tasty Isaan cuisine

data.title: Tourism Authority expects 1.56 million foreign arrivals for New Year
data.description: Thailand is expected to generate 62 billion baht in tourism revenue from Thai and foreign travellers during the New Year festival, up 23% year-on-year, the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) said on Thursday.

data.title: Cheaper domestic flights up for grabs
data.description: National airline offers 8,000 flights to major domestic destinations over New Year holidays at a 30% discount

data.title: South Korea's Yoon replaces defense chief amid looming impeachment vote
data.description: South Korea’s president accepted the resignation of his defense minister Thursday as opposition parties moved to impeach both men over the stunning yet short-lived imposition of martial law that brought armed troops into Seoul streets.

data.title: People's Party urges action to curb PM2.5
data.description: The People

data.title: Ho Chi Minh City promises to be bridge between Vietnam, Thailand
data.description: HCM City will be an active bridge to foster friendship and close cooperation between Vietnam and Thailand, a city leader has pledged.

data.title: Vietnam rises to the top 11 largest exporters globally
data.description: According to the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Vietnam has advanced significantly in import-export rankings and now stands second in ASEAN, trailing only Singapore.

data.title: JAT-NB3 Set for Exciting Year-End Showdown in Thailand
data.description: The Junior Asian Tour (JAT) – Notah Begay III (NB3) series is gearing up for its fourth tournament of 2024, promising an intense and thrilling contest to cap off the year. The event, scheduled from December 6-8, will take place at the picturesque Lotus Valley Golf Resort in Chachoengsao.

data.title: Viet Nam rises to the top 11 largest exporters globally
data.description: According to the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Viet Nam has advanced significantly in import-export rankings and now stands second in ASEAN, trailing only Singapore.

data.title: HCM City promises to be bridge between Viet Nam, Thailand
data.description: HCM City will be an active bridge to foster friendship and close cooperation between Viet Nam and Thailand, a city leader has pledged.

data.title: Trumpet star to perform with RBSO
data.description: Russian-born Israeli trumpet player Sergei Nakariakov will be guest soloist in the next concert by the Royal Bangkok Symphony Orchestra (RBSO) which will take place in the Main Hall of Thailand Cultural Centre, Ratchadaphisek Road, on Dec 14 at 7.30pm.

data.title: Chiang Mai set to showcase local talent
data.description: The local creativity of Chiang Mai will be showcased on a global scale during Chiang Mai Design Week 2024, which will kick off this Saturday and run until Dec 15.

data.title: Sacred Buddha tooth relic at Sanam Luang from today
data.description: The public is being invited to pay respects to the sacred relic of the Buddha

data.title: M9 link to Nonthaburi is approved
data.description: The cabinet has approved the new 35km M9 motorway project linking Bangkok

data.title: New taxes for EVs
data.description: The national committee in charge of promoting the electric-vehicle (EV) industry has approved a new car tax structure to support the production of hybrid vehicles as part of a plan to convert internal combustion engines to electric power.

data.title: People's Party urges action to curb PM2.5
data.description: The People

data.title: Archaeologists examine Iron Age skeletons, pottery
data.description: Archaeologists are investigating the discovery of ancient human skeletons and pottery shards near the Sab Pradu Reservoir in Nakhon Ratchasima

data.title: More medicines made free for patients
data.description: The National Drug System Development Committee has added more drugs to the national list of essential medicines that patients can benefit from free of charge.

data.title: Buriram and Johor stay in hunt after fiery battle
data.description: Buriram United could only pick up a point following a goalless draw with Malaysia

data.title: Sacred Buddha tooth relic at Sanam Luang from Thursday
data.description: The public is being invited to pay respects to the sacred relic of the Buddha

data.title: How a country’s economy was looted dry by politicians
data.description: DHAKA - The new governor of Bangladesh’s central bank, Ahsan Mansur, calculates that about US$17 billion was looted from the country’s financial system by politicians in the 15 years before the government of Sheikh Hasina collapsed in August.

data.title: Calls grow for South Korean president to quit
data.description: SEOUL — South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday proposed impeaching President Yoon Suk Yeol for his sudden decision to declare martial law, which he rescinded after a chaotic standoff between parliament and the army that damaged the country’s standing.

data.title: CEO fatally shot outside New York hotel
data.description: The chief executive of one of America’s largest health insurers was fatally shot outside a hotel in New York City hotel on Wednesday morning, the New York Police Department said.

data.title: ‘Classified’ data suggest huge Russian losses in Ukraine
data.description: LONDON - Forty-eight thousand relatives of Russian troops have submitted DNA samples, a government minister has been recorded as saying, in a sensitive discussion apparently referring to attempts to identify dead soldiers by their remains.

data.title: Russian actress's family bids farewell after she drowns in Samui waves
data.description: The father and boyfriend of a Russian actress who tragically drowned after being swept off a cliff by waves while practicing yoga in Ko Samui have arrived to claim her body and perform a Buddhist funeral ceremony.

data.title: Ex-minister seen in Chiang Mai after release from prison
data.description: CHIANG MAI - Former commerce minister  Boonsong Teriyapirom  has been seen in public for the first time since his release on  parole  on Monday, after serving more than seven years in prison for corruption linked to the Yingluck Shinawatra government’s  rice pledging  scheme.

data.title: Minister denies detention rule could favour Yingluck
data.description: Justice Minister Tawee Sodsong on Wednesday dismissed claims that a new regulation allowing for the  detention  of inmates outside prison would benefit fugitive former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra .

data.title: Siam Paragon’s 19th Anniversary: A Magical Milestone
data.description: Siam Paragon, a name synonymous with luxury and global prestige, marks its 19th anniversary with a dazzling celebration aptly titled “Siam Paragon 19th Anniversary: The Magical Celebration.” Running from December 2 to 10, 2024, the festivities showcase why this iconic destination remains a favourite among Thais and international visitors alike.

data.title: PalFish Opens Second English Learning Centre in Thailand
data.description: PalFish Thailand proudly celebrated the grand opening of its second  PalFish Experience Center  at  Future Park Rangsit  (Campus Park, 3rd Floor, Central Zone) on  3 December 2024.  Designed for children aged 3–15, this state-of-the-art centre offers one-on-one English lessons with native-speaking teachers, supported by cutting-edge technology and interactive applications for a modern, effective learning experience.
